body:
The recommended way is this : 
1.Manually set overflow location in sqconfig:
begin overflow
hdd /opt/scratch2
end overflow
2. Create these scratch folders if not exist and set trafodion permission for them on all nodes
3. Run sqgen
4. Sqstart

Above is the manual way. But the pyinstaller now accepts a : separated list of scratch locations also. These can be specified at install time. The above 2 methods can be used to change either the env setting permanently. If not, the CQD can be used to temprarily influence the settings for a session . These settings will not get stored in ms.env and will override the env settings only as long as the CQD is in effect.

The 2 envvars are  STFS_HDD_LOACTION(default) or STFS_SSD_LOCATION (for SSD disks)
See these JIRAs for the installer work adn stfs work : https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TRAFODION-2114
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TRAFODION-2146
How does it feel to have submitted pull request #1000?

Sounds rather selfish. I was so pleased yesterday when I noticed that this PR had the magic number. I have been watching the numbers inch along and was waiting for someone to get to this mark.

Remarkably most of Dallas is excited about a similar milestone. Dirk Nowitzki reached 30,000 points in his NBA career yesterday too. We have reached 1000 as a team!
If anyone deserves to be honored with a special or magic number, it's you! Enjoy.

Thanks Sandhya & Dave, for your explanations. 
Your comments have been incorporated. :)
Will have a review session to walk through the change next week.
Looks fine to me, though I've never published to the Apache maven repo. Release manager will be the lucky one to do it for first time.

I can "cherry-pick" this commit into Release 2.1 if needed, so you don't need to change it this time. For your next pull request, here is how you can make the pull request go into Release 2.1: 

* Specify the 2.1 branch when you check out the source code: git checkout ... origin/release2.1
* When creating the pull request, make sure the branches at the top of the screen are set to release2.1 and that the changes you see are only what you edited, not other commits.
* Once Release 2.1 is done, you can go back to your current method.
@sandhyasun, do you have any comments on this change?
This needs to go into 2.1 actually , doesn't it ?  I'll have to do it the first time when we release 2.1
Please do not commit this yet, as I am running the regression tests over the weekend.

Thanks Hans, for the explanations.
I will make the pull request go into R2.1 next time. :)
Regressions passed, so this is ready to merge. I will merge it.

Does this require pam to be enabled to use pyinstaller?  That seems problematic.  The jira refers to this being a problem for limit settings.  Perhaps a warning that the limits settings need to be done manually?

@sandhyasun, could you please review?

@AlexPeng19, could you please supply the JIRA as part of the pull request title?

This is the same as JIRA 2513 . If so this looks good.    The PR https://github.com/apache/incubator-trafodion/pull/983   has already been reviewed.  We can merge this to 2.1 now and abandon the other PR 983.
No need to merge this PR.  The PR https://github.com/apache/incubator-trafodion/pull/1004 will get merged to branch 2.1 . And then it will make it's way to "master". So we can close/abandon this PR.

Apologies, @sandhyasun, I committed this before seeing your comments.

It sounds like @prashanth-vasudev fixes are correct, but there are more places where similar fixes are needed?
The changes are fine - no issues.
@anoopsharma00, Is there a JIRA for these changes?

The purgedata issue is tracked by this JIRA. 
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TRAFODION-1702
It is now assigned to Anoop.
Nice change to get the boost in performance. Is it necessary to do a full index scan to get the parallel index scan plan?

Good fix Dave. I likely caused this when salted indexes were initially added. Have been concerned about poor plans for index scans, but never thought of looking in the generator.

Could you please take a look at https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TRAFODION-2512? I am curious to see if this change solves the problem in 2512 too.

Thanks Ming. 
Yes, I will do cherry pick into R2.1 branch after merge this PR. :)
Error 8583 is a generic error returned when aqr is invoked and a previous compilation failed.  Need to investigate further to see if a different (or better) warning can be returned.

@selvaganesang, I just tried a query with a key predicate on a leading index column and got a parallel plan. So we do get parallel plans on index scans even if we aren't doing full scans. I tried one with an equality predicate (expected result row count of only 4) and it chose a serial index scan plan. I think that's a good choice in my example as it did a unique access on each region.

@sureshsubbiah, this fix might help JIRA TRAFODION-2512 in that it might pick a parallel index scan. However, there's a known issue with RangeSpecs and MDAM costing code: When RangeSpecs are present, the Optimizer chooses to traverse all columns in the key of the index if MDAM is chosen, when in this example, it could just do MDAM on the first column. For a discussion of that issue, see https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TRAFODION-1641. I'll play with the example in 2512 and see how it behaves.

@sureshsubbiah, I tried an example like the one in JIRA TRAFODION-2512. I used a table 1/10th of the size of the one in the case because I was on a workstation rather than a cluster. I have good news and bad news. The good news is we indeed now choose a parallel plan with an index scan, and the index scan uses MDAM. The bad news is (as I feared above) the MDAM access traverses all the columns, when it could stop at column B. So, it might be an improvement but we could do much better once the second issue from JIRA TRAFODION-1641 is properly fixed.
I will merge this tomorrow morning if there are no negative comments.

@sureshsubbiah, I executed the statement SS using the parallel index scan on my workstation; it executed in 9 seconds elapsed. I then reprepared it after setting CQD HIDE_INDEXES 'OFF' so that I'd get the old plan (table access). It executes in 23 seconds. So with this particular data set, the query is improved with this fix, even though the use of MDAM is not optimal.
Hi, I am implementing the LOB support for JDBC. I found the limit of lob size for "update lob" support is not correct computed. So I created this Pull request.
@sbroeder, does this look good to you? If so I will commit it.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
